tutorial.title: Styling with One Line
tutorial.descriptionContent: Advance your CSS and write less code by learning how to use shorthands to set individual paddings on elements.

lessons.title: Intro: Box model
lessons.interactiveContent: Any element has four paddings counted clockwise from top to right, to bottom, to left.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
So far we've learned to set the padding for each side of an element one at a time.

Make sure to pick 20px followed by 20px and then 20px, 20px.

executableContent.instructions:
We can set each padding value in one line using the `padding` property and a pixel value for each side. 

Ask AI to apply a **20px** to all sides. We'll explain how it works shortly.

files.name: index.html
files.content: Mike's balloons

files.name: style.css

lessons.title: One Line
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can set each padding value in one line using the padding property and a pixel value for each side.

Make sure to pick padding followed by 20px and then 20px, 20px, 20px.

lessons.title: Padding top
lessons.interactiveContent:
To position the content lower inside an element, add a top padding by setting the first value to 100px.

Make sure to pick 100px.

lessons.title: Padding right and left
lessons.interactiveContent:
To set the right padding to something like 40px, we change the second value. To set the left padding to 100px, we change the fourth value.

Make sure to pick 40px, followed by 100px.

lessons.title: Padding bottom
lessons.interactiveContent:
To add padding to the bottom, set the third value to 100px.

Make sure to type 100px.

lessons.title: Zero
lessons.interactiveContent:
When we don't want to add padding to one side, we can add 0 and leave out px since it's optional.

Make sure to pick 0, followed by 0, and finally 0.

lessons.title: Question: Box model
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we set values for the padding shorthand?

Clockwise, from top, to right, to bottom, to leftCounterclockwise, from top, to left, to bottom, to right

Clockwise, from top, to right, to bottom, to left.

lessons.title: Question: Padding top
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which value sets the top padding in this code?

The first value, 20pxThe third value, 40px

The first value, 20px.

lessons.title: Question: Padding right and left
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which paddings are greater than 0?

The right and left paddingsThe left and bottom paddings

The right and left paddings.

lessons.title: Question: Padding bottom
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the third value of padding do?

It sets the bottom paddingIt sets the right padding

It sets the bottom padding.

lessons.title: Question: Zero
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set a padding to 0 with the shorthand and leave out px?

It's OK, px is optional when the value is 0The code doesn't work

It's OK, px is optional when the value is 0.

lessons.title: Example: Box model
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the property used to set the padding for the h3 element.

Make sure to type padding.

lessons.title: Example: Padding top
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the first value to set the top padding to 50px.

Make sure to type 50px.

lessons.title: Example: Padding right and left
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the right and left padding to 75px.

Make sure to pick 0 followed by 75px and then 0, 75px.

lessons.title: Example: Padding bottom
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the third value to set the bottom padding to 300px.

Make sure to type 300px.

lessons.title: Example: Zero
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the top padding to 25px, the right padding to 50px, the bottom padding to 25px, and the left padding to 0.

Make sure to pick 25px followed by 50px and then 25px, 0.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: Shorthands work with the margin and border-radius properties, making it possible to create interesting styles with fewer lines of code.

lessons.title: Margins right
lessons.interactiveContent:
To set the right and left margins to 15px in one line, we can use the margin shorthand.

Make sure to pick margin, followed by 15px, and finally 15px.

lessons.title: Top and bottom
lessons.interactiveContent:
To add top and bottom margins, we set the first and third value to 40px.

Make sure to pick 40px, followed by 40px.

lessons.title: Border-radius
lessons.interactiveContent:
The border-radius property with four values rounds the corners in a clockwise direction starting from the top-left.

Make sure to pick border-radius followed by 30px and then 30px, 30px, 30px.

lessons.title: One corner
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can round just the top-left corner by changing the first value to 50px and leaving the rest as 0.

Make sure to pick 50px followed by 0 and then 0, 0.

lessons.title: Extreme value
lessons.interactiveContent:
To take border-radius to the extreme, we can set a corner to the same value as the height or width, like 100px in this case.

Make sure to pick 100px.

lessons.title: Unique images
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can use border-radius to give images a unique touch by doing things like rounding the top-right and bottom-left corners to 20px.

Make sure to pick 20px, followed by 20px.

lessons.title: Question: Margins right
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the order of values for the margin shorthand?

Top, right, bottom, leftTop, right, left, bottom

Top, right, bottom, left.

lessons.title: Question: Top and bottom
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this code?

It has five values instead of fourpx doesn't need to be added

It has five values instead of four.

lessons.title: Question: Border-radius
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the order of values for the border-radius property?

Top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-leftBottom-right, bottom-left, top-left, top-right

Top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left.

lessons.title: Question: One corner
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set border-radius to these values?

Images have a rounded top-right cornerButtons have a rounded top-right corner

Images have a rounded top-right corner.

lessons.title: Question: Border-radius
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set border-radius to these values?

Paragraph elements have a rounded bottom-right cornerImage elements have rounded corners

Paragraph elements have a rounded bottom-right corner.

lessons.title: Question: Unique images
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this code?

There's a semicolon after each value0 doesn't have px after it

There's a semicolon after each value.

lessons.title: Example: Top and bottom
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the top margin to 20px and the left margin to 20px.

Make sure to pick 20px, followed by 20px.

lessons.title: Example: Border-radius
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set border-radius for the top-right and bottom-right corners to the same value as the height property.

Make sure to pick 150px, followed by 150px.

lessons.title: Example: One corner
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the top-right corner and the bottom-left corner to 100px, and the other corners to 0.

Make sure to pick 0 followed by 100px and then 0, 100px.

lessons.title: Example: Extreme value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the top-left corner to 100px and the bottom-right corner to 100px.

Make sure to pick 100px followed by 0 and then 100px, 0.

executableContent.instructions: Ask AI to set the image's border radius so that its shape resembles a water drop. Then, ask it to explain the changes.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
The Shape of Water

A charity working on bringing clean water to the third world.

files.name: style.css
